body: Did you download/unpack the files and run them as the same user?

Yes. I downloaded the files stated in the step by step tutorial (python and video 2x). Then i ran the video2x_setup.py as the same user. It downloaded the dependencies but got an error when it got to generating video 2x configuration file.

I am the admin of my computer so I dont know why it gives permission error.
Have you tried running it as administrator?
Isn't it meant to run in the command prompt? How would I run it as administrator in the command prompt?
Well run command prompt as admin.

Thanks for the help! I successfully setup video 2x. But now another problem has happened... :(

When I run it says "an exception has occurred" and stops.
![42](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/49539812/56074525-6e597980-5d82-11e9-8bf8-60665ba9a6a9.PNG)
It looks like that waifu2x-caffe failed. Do you have the CUDA driver installed?

Okay I installed CUDA from Nvidia website but it removed my Nvidia
graphics card drivers, and now my computer doesn't recognize my graphics
card any more.

You .. don't need the CUDA toolkit. Just the regular graphics card driver is fine.

Hi there! I new an very enthusiastic in lossless video upscaling.
This is what I found in a german forum regarding this issue:

"Nvidia has removed the implementation of the CUDA-based encoder (nvcuenc.dll) with version 340.52 from the drivers."
...
"If you cannot see the "H.264 (Nvidia® CUDA™)" option...

Please try the solutions below:
1. Check your graphics card driver
NVIDIA removed the nvcuvenc.dll file from the GeForce 340.43 beta driver.

1) If you use Windows 7/8/10 (64bit), download cuda_enc_windows7_8_64bit.zip and copy&paste the nvcuvenc.dll file to the designated folder. (C:\Windows\System32\nvcuvenc.dll and C:\Windows\SysWOW64\nvcuvenc.dll)

2) If you use Windows 7/8/10 (32bit), download cuda_enc_windows7_8_32bit.zip and copy&paste the nvcuvenc.dll file to the designated folder. (C:\Windows\System32\nvcuvenc.dll)


http://www.bandicam.com/img/forum/cuda_enc_windows7_8_64bit.zip

http://www.bandicam.com/img/forum/cuda_enc_windows7_8_32bit.zip

Works for me for all programs"

Greets
@Urgeistenergie Thank you for the suggestions, but ffmpeg and waifu2x are supposed to work with GeForce 419.35+ though. If he installed the newest drivers correctly, there shouldn't be a problem.

Thank you! It worked. 

I got a question tho. Does it work with mkv files?
@kelsieer should work with all formats that ffmpeg supports (i.e. mkv should work fine.)
